Jean Dujardin gets Connery's mannerisms down pat: the adjusting the cuff links when entering a club as all the women turn to admire him, the silly squint of annoyance, the well-trimmed dark hair and the quiet, measured voice. It's playful and (useful) exaggeration of a style that brings a genuine physicality to all his roles, particular in his role as one half of a gal and guy team of magicians.
